intro: Crateria fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that often grow in clusters. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Crateria fasciculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
